question: Well...how do you feel?
answer: Ask me in about five minutes.

question: I'm talking about graduation. Being totally free to do whatever we want now.
answer: It feels excellent.

question: What's wrong?
answer: Nothing.

question: C'mon, Jimmy. Something's bothering you.
answer: It's just that we're right around that old summer camp where all those murders took place.

question: What murders?
answer: Never mind, you don't want to know about it.

question: Tell me.
answer: There's nothing to worry about, Suzy. The guy's dead now, somewhere at the bottom of this lake...if you believe the stories. Let's drop it, okay?

question: What stories?
answer: There was this boy named Jason Voorhees who drowned in Crystal Lake...

question: There was this boy named Jason Voorhees who drowned in Crystal Lake...
answer: Hhhhelp....me....I'm drowning...

question: None of the counselors heard him.
answer: Mmmmmmommy....

question: Legend has it that Jason came back to avenge his mother's death, vowing to kill every teenager from the area. And every now and then, the murders start up again. Forget about it, Suzy. They're just stories.
answer: We're the last graduating class, right?

question: Right.
answer: I mean, Lakeview High just closed its doors for good, right?

question: Right.
answer: So there's no reason for him to come back because there won't be any of us around...right?

question: as the anchor drifts along the lake floor, tugging hard on the power cable. Camera TRACKS along the cable, coming to a RUSTY SET OF CHAINS TANGLED AROUND IT.
answer: as Jim slides on top of Suzy. Thoughts of Jason are starting to slip away along with their clothes.

question: as the chains emit a dull tinkle due to movement from the tugging anchor. Camera continues to TRACK again...and we find to our horror that the waterlogged, fish-eaten body of JASON IS SECURED BY THESE SAME CHAINS.
answer: Teenagers in love, lost in not-so-innocent passion. At the same moment:

question: The anchor tugs one last time and RIPS THROUGH THE CABLE. SPARKS INSTANTLY FLY, chasing along the cable, finding the chain which secures Jason and ENGULFING HIM IN
answer: as Suzy's eyes flash open.

question: Everything okay?
answer: Just felt a little chill.

question: Did you know that I'm giving up teaching?
answer: Really?

question: Since the school is closing anyway, I'm going to write that novel I've been threatening on everybody.
answer: That's wonderful, Miss Van Deusen...what's it about?

question: A senior class cruise to Manhattan, laced with romance, adventure and murder. Or a Gothic cook book. I haven't decided which. Go on, open it. Stephen King supposedly used it when he was in high school.
answer: I don't know what to say...

question: Hi, Mrs. Watanabe. Just kidding.
answer: Don't worry about a thing, Mom. I'll have a terrific time and I won't do anything stupid, okay?

question: I hear the crew members are cute guys in their twenties.
answer: Really?

question: I'm sure we'll have no problem getting them to party with us...especially with this. It's my graduation gift from Daddy. It cost over a thousand bucks but it's the best.
answer: He bought you that?

question: More or less. It's part of my college fund.
answer: You can stop right there, Miss Mason.

question: What are you talking about? You can't do that...
answer: It's already been done. Congratulations on the 3.9 average, Miss Watanabe. You're in stateroom two- fifty-five.

question: Hello, Charles. Has everyone checked in?
answer: Jim Miller and Suzy Donaldson never showed up. I'm a little concerned.

question: Don't be. They probably decided to explore each other rather than New York.
answer: Let's go -- we're running two minutes late.

question: You have no right...
answer: And neither do you. It's up to Rennie to decide what she wants to do.

question: She doesn't know what she wants. She's never had a stable life.
answer: And she sure doesn't have one now, either. She needs to live.

question: I'm her legal guardian, not you or anybody else, and I alone know what's best for her. End of discussion.
answer: No, I think it's just the beginning.

question: Yeah, tell me about it. Rennie...
answer: Hi, Sean.

question: I heard you weren't coming.
answer: We changed our minds.

question: I got you a present.
answer: But I didn't get you one...

question: Forget it. It's a dumb little thing anyway.
answer: Sean...it's beautiful.

question: I thought maybe we could hike to the top of the Statue when we got there, if you felt like it. It's supposed to be 22 stories tall.
answer: I'd love to.

question: There's a storm predicted tonight. You're making a big mistake, Rennie. It's not too late to put you back on land.
answer: I'm staying.

question: If Miss Van Deusen knew how afraid you were of...
answer: She didn't push me into coming.

question: Why are you doing this to yourself?
answer: I don't even know why I'm afraid, Uncle Charles. I can't even remember when it started. Don't you think it's time I found out and got over it?

question: Facing your fear doesn't always conquer it.
answer: I'm staying.

question: I'm not sure we're supposed to be here, Tamara.
answer: Is that a muscular bod or what? He's undefeated, you know that? Julius is the only senior I'd even consider doing it with. If he wasn't black, that is.

question: My parents are open minded about that sort of thing.
answer: My stepmom couldn't care less, but Daddy would have a shit fit. He might even pay some attention to me. Gorgeous guy at ten o'clock. Look sensual. I think it's time for some recreational activity, girl.

question: Sounds good. I hear there's a shuffleboard court on deck -- it might be kinds cool...
answer: You're joking, right?

question: Have you seen my niece anywhere?
answer: Yeah, motivating downstairs, I think. What's the problem, Mr. McCulloch?

question: Senior predictions started five minutes ago and she hasn't shown up.
answer: Some of us don't want our futures predicted.

question: The night time is the right time.
answer: No thanks.

question: What? Don't be a lightweight...this is top dollar toot.
answer: It's not that, it's just that... It I get caught, I'll lose my science scholarship and everything.

question: You're talking to the prom queen, Eva. Do you really think I'm going to risk getting caught?
answer: I guess not.

question: Is that unbelievable or what?
answer: appears from the shadows, just as startled to see them. It's not Jason at all. Rennie can't help noticing the cocaine, trying hard to ignore it.

question: Jesus, you scared the hell out of us.
answer: Have you seen my dog? I think he came this way.

question: No, we haven't. Care for a hit?
answer: No thanks.

question: Rennie -- I was just on my way over to your room
answer: Have you seen my dog anywhere?

question: No, but I'm sure Toby's fine. The ship's only so big and there's certainly no way off it, is there? So, are you having fun yet?
answer: Yeah...a lot.

question: I seem to detect a hint of ingenuousness in your tone. In other words, level with me.
answer: There's something I haven't told you...

question: That was truly excellent.
answer: Yeah.

question: Time to check out the waiters.
answer: I think I'll pass. See you later, okay?

question: Bring her a towel, okay? She's fine -- everybody go back to what you were doing. Care to talk about it?
answer: I can't swim.

question: I gathered that. I had a skiing accident in high school, broke my left leg. It took three winters before I would even look at the snow again...but the solution kept eluding me. I finally took lessons. I've never broken a bone since.
answer: It's not that simple.

question: Maybe not. But you're not telling me everything, are you?
answer: Whenever I get near the water, I see this young boy drowning. He tries to pull me down with him.

question: When did this start?
answer: About four years ago...at Crystal Lake. I spent a few summers there with Uncle Charles inbetween boarding school.

question: After your parents passed away? Did you have an accident in the lake?
answer: No. It was just a normal summer. I've never been able to figure it out.

question: Wouldn't you like a glass of champagne first, Charles?
answer: Where did you get that alcohol?

question: I packed it. Just for us.
answer: That's it. You're not setting foot off this ship until we return home.

question: But I haven't even shown you my biology project... Take a closer look, Charles. I want to make sure I labeled all my organs correctly.
answer: Oh, you've done it now. Not only are you going home, I'll see to it that you spend next year back in a high school classroom!

question: Relax, Wayne. He won't risk doing a thing. Can I have the tape?
answer: This is going to sound supremely lame...but I've had the major hots for you since our sophomore year, Tamara.

question: That's sweet, Wayne. Look, I'd love to chat but I'm really pressed for time. Let's try to get together later, okey- doke?
answer: But I thought...

question: Thanks for the camerawork.
answer: Wayne, you're an asshole.

question: Let's kick in the stablilizers, Mr. Carlson, and get the seas off the quarter. These kids are in for one hell of a storm.
answer: Yes Sir. Activating comfort cruise mode.

question: gets a reflective look in his weary eyes.
answer: Nineteen months.

question: A tremendous age. Take some advice from a salty old man
answer: This is the bridge. Approaching weather suggests we secure the main deck and...

question: Stay calm, but get here as quick as possible. Walk with a friend if you can... God, I wish this was a joke, but it's not.
answer: What is happening???

question: I don't know...we've gone off course or something...
answer: What do you mean???

question: I don't know what I mean! All's I know is that there's no one guiding this ship anymore...
answer: Can't you call for help??

question: I think so. But we have to lower the anchors so we don't drift any further...
answer: Where are they?

question: The bow...front of the ship. There's a hoist on each side that lowers them I didn't mean for you to go!
answer: Just radio for help, okay???

question: Channel 16...the distress frequency... Mayday, mayday, mayday...this is the Princess Ruby. Please, somebody answer...
answer: This is Coast Guard cutter Dallas. What is the nature of your problem, Ruby?

question: The Captain and Chief Engineer... they've been...they're dead.
answer: What is your location?

question: I...I don't know...
answer: Is your ship equipped with Omega satellite navigation or LORAN?

question: Yes...
answer: The LORAN has a digital printout of your latitude and longitude. Give me the coordinates and we'll be there as quick as we can.

question: I've got the numbers.
answer: Give me the degrees first, followed by minutes and sec...

question: You're all going to die. You're the last ones. He's come back for you.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: Jason Voorhees.
answer: You're insane, old man. Jason Voorhees has been dead for over thirty years.

question: He walks this ship, here and now.
answer: A killer walks this ship indeed. And it's certainly none of us...

question: What's going on? I heard on the P.A. system that...
answer: The Captain's been murdered. The buzz is that Jason might be on board.

question: Jason...Voorhees? Have you seen Tamara?
answer: No. And I'm not losing any sleep over it.

question: But she might be in trouble...
answer: So what else is new? Look Eva, you're asking the wrong dude to feel sorry for Tamara Mason. Wise up -- it's not hip to be her friend.

question: I don't care about being hip anymore.
answer: I'm sorry, but I've gotta find J.J.

question: through the crack in the door, watching Rennie unexpectedly take off. He's about to move after her when ha hears:
answer: Tamara? Are you around here anywhere? Tamara?

question: moving down the same corridor, catching a glimpse of Eva before she turns a corner and disappears.
answer: Tamara? I just want to talk with you. shrieks, running back out the door...

question: chasing after her with the smooth determination of a shark, never letting her get too far in the lead.
answer: decides this is the wrong place to be. She moves for the corridor again and:

question: decides this is the wrong place to be. She moves for the corridor again and:
answer: appears on the corridor steps for a brief second. The spotlight goes black, then flashes on again. Now he's gone.

question: backs away, sliding along the edge of the dance floor like she's on a building ledge. Chaser lights and mirror balls fondle her body as she moves as far away from the point where she last saw him. But:
answer: illuminates only ten feet from her, a crimson strobe assaulting his hockey mask. She's on a collision course with him.

question: Toby? Where'd you go?
answer: moving up to the bow door like Jason did before, cracking it open, seeing Rennie from behind. And moving towards her.

question: is oblivious as she reads the directions above the controls.
answer: He's now within ten feet of the unaware girl.

question: remains in the hoist box, making certain it is operating correctly. A second later, we see the fleeting outline of a HUMAN SHAPE appear behind her.
answer: Three feet from Rennie. She spins around to climb out of the hoist box and GASPS.

question: I managed to scrounge this shit from the game room and hallways. Grab what you want.
answer: What are you taking, Julius?

question: Nothin'.
answer: We're talking the possibility of Jason Voorhees here.

question: Can't we at least talk about it?
answer: I refuse to discuss this ridiculous notion that a ghoul is terrorizing this ship.

question: But what about the drowning boy I've been seeing?
answer: Whatever you've been...imagining... has nothing to do with Jason Voorhees. I want you to be safe, Rennie. That's all I care about.

question: I'm not staying in my room, Uncle Charles.
answer: This isn't a request.

question: What was that??
answer: I don't know.

question: What happens if we don't get control of the ship, Sean? I want you to tell me the truth.
answer: We could hit a reef, collide with another ship...we could be out here for weeks before anybody spotted us.

question: Can you shut that damn thing off??
answer: We already thought of that -- nobody could possibly see it in this storm... What about the fire??

question: I doubt very much that one even exists.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: feels the skin on her face crawling off her skull, her eyes expanding because she's now looking at:
answer: Hhhhelp....me....

question: screams with guttural fear, letting go of herself, watching her younger self drown in the hole in her room.
answer: disappears under the surface of the water...which seconds later CHANGES BACK INTO HER OVAL RUG.

question: sinks to the floor, scrambling on all fours to get as far away from the porthole as possible. She makes it across the room to her stateroom door just as:
answer: Rennie...??

question: The window... I don't understand what is happening to me...
answer: It's gonna be okay...

question: What is it??
answer: The power room...

question: Rule one, don't panic. Rule two, assess the damage and act accordingly...
answer: Is the ship going to sink??

question: I don't know. The emergency lights just kicked in... We'll be okay. I want you to wait by the lifeboats, just in case.
answer: I'm not going near any lifeboat!

question: But Rennie...
answer: I'm not!!

question: Not another word, do you hear me??
answer: turns to see JASON APPROACHING THEM WITH AXE RAISED. She backs away but Jason ignores her, heading directly for the hoist. He arches back with his weapon and SLICES sees it all, her intestines constricting in agonizing knots. She summons all her rationale and sends it down to her legs, running away as fast as she can.

question: Why aren't you with the others, woman??
answer: Jason...he has an axe...

question: What a beautiful day.
answer: Perfect for a swim, isn't it? You've been coming out here every summer for the last three years, young lady, and you still haven't learned how.

question: I'll take some lessons this time. I promise.
answer: That's what you said last year. I think the time for your first swimming lesson has just come. You don't want to end up drowning like that Voorhees boy, do you? He never learned how either and he's still at the bottom of this lake.

question: He is not.
answer: Oh, he is indeed. And ready to pull down anybody who falls in and can't swim.

question: You're telling a lie.
answer: Am I? Let's find out. Better swim before Jason drags you down, Rennie. Come on, you can do it...
